question:
employers sometimes ask people applying for jobs for personal information such as their hobbies and interests and whether they are married or single some people say that this information may be relevant and useful other disagree
 discuss about these views and give your own opinion
text: Getting essential details of new employees is really imortant by employers when they are recuiting. These information can be consist of a wide categories varying from their qualifications to their personal data. No one can be quiet certain about whether this information can be one hundred percent beneficial or not.

Some people believe, employer only should ask about crucial things such as academic qualifications and degrees which are related to their education because they only require their knowlege to utilizt at any workplace and getting any detail about personal life of new workforce would be useless. In addition, in their point of view, anything such as their entertainments, sports abilities or maternity situation which are not related to their area of specilazation not play any role in making progress and  only satisfy the employer's sense of curiosity.

Some other inhabitants argure that how much an employer know more about their staff the more achievement can be obtain by them as a team. Because for attaining better results and goals working team members and coworkers must be matched more. For instance, by knowning the general qualities, features, characteristics, lifestyles, social situation, various skills containing social, sports, artistic by the manager divding duties and responsibilities become more easier and helpful. As a result, having knowlege about all sides of personnel can help them to promote better and become more successful.

In conclusin, many people think that asking about a personal informaion is a useless job and it will not affecte any aspects of working but when we think as a professional manager we understand all psychological and physical in addition of academic degree must be asked. I agree with asking all aspects of people who are invited for interview to become more capable to deal with tasks and colleagues.
